It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pterigeron bubakii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
